title: [Large-scale] Environmental Health Basics Online Training: Pre-service Teacher Competency Enhancement Program

context.prior_knowledge: High School-Level Basic Science Knowledge and Awareness of Environmental Issues
context.additional_context: An online course for pre-service/in-service teachers to develop foundational theories and practical skills in environmental health. It emphasizes real-world competencies through learner interaction and project collaboration in a smartphone-based LMS environment.

learning_goals: Learners can explain core concepts in major environmental health fields (occupational and environmental health sciences, toxicology, industrial hygiene, etc.).
Learners can analyze real-world cases and propose environmental risk assessment and management strategies.
Learners can plan, execute, and evaluate environmental health education projects using online collaboration tools.
Learners can compare domestic and international environmental health policies and institutional roles, and propose educational applications.

resources: LMS Platforms (Discussion Boards, Quiz Features, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
